name: Rewiring Neurological Responses
description: Retraining the brain to stop reacting to PSN conditioning and reinforcing self-directed thought patterns.

cards.title: Breaking Neurochemical Addiction to PSNs
cards.description: Disrupting the biochemical reinforcement cycle that keeps people attached to PSNs.
bulletpoints: Understanding how dopamine and cortisol create emotional dependency on toxic individuals.
Using structured positive reinforcement to replace PSN-induced highs and lows.
Deploying thought interruption techniques to break automatic emotional responses.
cards.summaryText: Understand how dopamine and cortisol hook you emotionally to toxic people, use structured positive reinforcement to replace their highs and lows, and deploy thought interruption to break automatic emotional reactions.

cards.title: The 'No Contact' Neurological Reset
cards.description: How severing all contact rewires the brain for independence.
bulletpoints: Recognizing withdrawal symptoms and emotional cravings caused by trauma bonding.
Using cognitive priming to prevent relapse into old emotional patterns.
Building new habits to replace previous neural associations with the PSN.
cards.summaryText: Spot withdrawal symptoms and emotional cravings from trauma bonding, use cognitive priming to stop relapsing into old patterns, and build new habits to replace the neural links to the PSN.

cards.title: Cognitive Anchoring for Mental Freedom
cards.description: Anchoring thoughts and emotions in self-reinforcing frameworks to prevent reattachment.
bulletpoints: Developing mental scripts to counteract PSN-induced cognitive distortions.
Using sensory reinforcement (smells, visuals, music) to override old trauma cues.
Practicing memory reconsolidation to remove emotional charges from past experiences.
cards.summaryText: Develop mental scripts to counter PSN-induced distortions, use sensory reinforcement like smells or music to override old trauma cues, and practice memory reconsolidation to strip emotional charges from the past.
